048/**
049 * Provides different utilities methods to apply processing from a security perspective.<br>
050 * These code snippet:
051 * <ul>
052 *     <li>Can be used, as "foundation", to customize the validation to the app context.</li>
053 *     <li>Were implemented in a way to facilitate adding or removal of validations depending on usage context.</li>
054 *     <li>Were centralized on one class to be able to enhance them across time as well as <a href="https://github.com/righettod/code-snippets-security-utils/issues">missing case/bug identification</a>.</li>
055 * </ul>
056 */
057public class SecurityUtils {
058
059    /**
060     * Default constructor: Not needed as the class only provides static methods.
061     */
062    private SecurityUtils() {
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Apply a collection of validation to verify if a provided PIN code is considered weak (easy to guess) or none.<br>
067     * This method consider that format of the PIN code is [0-9]{6,}<br>
068     * Rule to consider a PIN code as weak:<br>
069     * - Length is inferior to 6 positions.<br>
070     * - Contain only the same number or only a sequence of zero.<br>
071     * - Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers.<br>
072     *
073     * @param pinCode PIN code to verify.
074     * @return True only if the PIN is considered as weak.
075     */
076    public static boolean isWeakPINCode(String pinCode) {
077        boolean isWeak = true;
078        //Length is inferior to 6 positions
079        //Use "Long.parseLong(pinCode)" to cause a NumberFormatException if the PIN is not a numeric one
080        //and to ensure that the PIN is not only a sequence of zero
081        if (pinCode != null && Long.parseLong(pinCode) > 0 && pinCode.trim().length() > 5) {
082            //Contain only the same number
083            String regex = String.format("^[%s]{%s}$", pinCode.charAt(0), pinCode.length());
084            if (!Pattern.matches(regex, pinCode)) {
085                //Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers
086                char previousChar = 'X';
087                boolean containSequence = false;
088                for (char c : pinCode.toCharArray()) {
089                    if (previousChar != 'X') {
090                        int previousNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(previousChar));
091                        int currentNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(c));
092                        if (currentNbr == (previousNbr - 1) || currentNbr == (previousNbr + 1)) {
093                            containSequence = true;
094                            break;
095                        }
096                    }
097                    previousChar = c;
098                }
099                if (!containSequence) {
100                    isWeak = false;
101                }
102            }
103        }
104        return isWeak;
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Apply a collection of validations on a Word 97-2003 (binary format) document file provided:<br>
109     * - Real Microsoft Word 97-2003 document file.<br>
110     * - No VBA Macro.<br>
111     * - No embedded objects.<br>
112     *
113     * @param wordFilePath Filename of the Word document file to check.
114     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
115     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/"
116     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/document/"
117     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/how-to.html"
118     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/embeded.html"
119     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/"
120     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.poi/poi"
121     */
122    public static boolean isWord972003DocumentSafe(String wordFilePath) {
123        boolean isSafe = false;
124        try {
125            File wordFile = new File(wordFilePath);
126            if (wordFile.exists() && wordFile.canRead() && wordFile.isFile()) {
127                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid Word 97-2003 format file
128                try (POIFSFileSystem fs = new POIFSFileSystem(wordFile)) {
129                    //Step 2: Check if the document contains VBA macros, in our case is not allowed
130                    VBAMacroReader macroReader = new VBAMacroReader(fs);
131                    Map<String, String> macros = macroReader.readMacros();
132                    if (macros == null || macros.isEmpty()) {
133                        //Step 3: Check if the document contains any embedded objects, in our case is not allowed
134                        //From POI documentation:
135                        //Word normally stores embedded files in subdirectories of the ObjectPool directory, itself a subdirectory of the filesystem root.
136                        //Typically, these subdirectories and named starting with an underscore, followed by 10 numbers.
137                        final List<String> embeddedObjectFound = new ArrayList<>();
138                        DirectoryEntry root = fs.getRoot();
139                        if (root.getEntryCount() > 0) {
140                            root.iterator().forEachRemaining(entry -> {
141                                if ("ObjectPool".equalsIgnoreCase(entry.getName()) && entry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
142                                    DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectory = (DirectoryEntry) entry;
143                                    if (objPoolDirectory.getEntryCount() > 0) {
144                                        objPoolDirectory.iterator().forEachRemaining(objPoolDirectoryEntry -> {
145                                            if (objPoolDirectoryEntry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
146                                                DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry = (DirectoryEntry) objPoolDirectoryEntry;
147                                                if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.getEntryCount() > 0) {
148                                                    objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.forEach(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry -> {
149                                                        if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.isDocumentEntry()) {
150                                                            embeddedObjectFound.add(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.getName());
151                                                        }
152                                                    });
153                                                }
154                                            }
155                                        });
156                                    }
157                                }
158                            });
159                        }
160                        isSafe = embeddedObjectFound.isEmpty();
161                    }
162                }
163            }
164        } catch (Exception e) {
165            isSafe = false;
166        }
167        return isSafe;
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Ensure that an XML file does not contain any External Entity, DTD or XInclude instructions.
172     *
173     * @param xmlFilePath Filename of the XML file to check.
174     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
175     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/xxe"
176     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html#java"
177     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/security/java-api-xml-processing-jaxp-security-guide.html#GUID-82F8C206-F2DF-4204-9544-F96155B1D258"
178     * @see "https://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude-11/"
179     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XInclude"
180     */
181    public static boolean isXMLSafe(String xmlFilePath) {
182        boolean isSafe = false;
183        try {
184            File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
185            if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
186                //Step 1a: Verify that the XML file content does not contain any XInclude instructions
187                boolean containXInclude = Files.readAllLines(xmlFile.toPath()).stream().anyMatch(line -> line.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).contains(":include "));
188                if (!containXInclude) {
189                    //Step 1b: Parse the XML file, if an exception occur than it's imply that the XML specified is not a valid ones
190                    //Create an XML document builder throwing Exception if a DOCTYPE instruction is present
191                    DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
192                    dbfInstance.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
193                    //Xerces 2 only
194                    //dbfInstance.setFeature("http://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/features.html#disallow-doctype-decl",true);
195                    dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
196                    DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
197                    //Parse the document
198                    Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
199                    isSafe = (doc != null && doc.getDocumentElement() != null);
200                }
201            }
202        } catch (Exception e) {
203            isSafe = false;
204        }
205        return isSafe;
206    }
207
208
209    /**
210     * Extract all URL links from a PDF file provided.<br>
211     * This can be used to apply validation on a PDF against contained links.
212     *
213     * @param pdfFilePath pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to process.
214     * @return A List of URL objects that is empty if no links is found.
215     * @throws Exception If any error occurs during the processing of the PDF file.
216     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
217     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
218     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
219     */
220    public static List<URL> extractAllPDFLinks(String pdfFilePath) throws Exception {
221        final List<URL> links = new ArrayList<>();
222        File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
223        try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
224            PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
225            AnnotationFilter actionURIAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
226                @Override
227                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
228                    boolean keep = false;
229                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
230                        keep = (((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction() instanceof PDActionURI);
231                    }
232                    return keep;
233                }
234            };
235            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
236                try {
237                    page.getAnnotations(actionURIAnnotationFilter).forEach(annotation -> {
238                        PDActionURI linkAnnotation = (PDActionURI) ((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction();
239                        try {
240                            URL urlObj = new URL(linkAnnotation.getURI());
241                            if (!links.contains(urlObj)) {
242                                links.add(urlObj);
243                            }
244                        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
245                            throw new RuntimeException(e);
246                        }
247                    });
248                } catch (Exception e) {
249                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
250                }
251            });
252        }
253        return links;
254    }
255
256    /**
257     * Apply a collection of validations on a PDF file provided:<br>
258     * - Real PDF file<br>
259     * - No attachments.<br>
260     * - No Javascript code.<br>
261     * - No links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData.<br>
262     *
263     * @param pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to check.
264     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
265     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/36161267"
266     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
267     * @see "https://github.com/jonaslejon/malicious-pdf"
268     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
269     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
270     */
271    public static boolean isPDFSafe(String pdfFilePath) {
272        boolean isSafe = false;
273        try {
274            File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
275            if (pdfFile.exists() && pdfFile.canRead() && pdfFile.isFile()) {
276                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid PDF file
277                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
278                    //Step 2: Check if the file contains attached files, in our case is not allowed
279                    PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
280                    PDDocumentNameDictionary namesDictionary = new PDDocumentNameDictionary(documentCatalog);
281                    if (namesDictionary.getEmbeddedFiles() == null) {
282                        //Step 3: Check if the file contains Javascript code, in our case is not allowed
283                        if (namesDictionary.getJavaScript() == null) {
284                            //Step 4: Check if the file contains links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData, in our case is not allowed
285                            final List<Integer> notAllowedAnnotationCounterList = new ArrayList<>();
286                            AnnotationFilter notAllowedAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
287                                @Override
288                                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
289                                    boolean keep = false;
290                                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
291                                        PDAnnotationLink link = (PDAnnotationLink) annotation;
292                                        PDAction action = link.getAction();
293                                        if ((action instanceof PDActionURI)
294                                                || (action instanceof PDActionLaunch)
295                                                || (action instanceof PDActionRemoteGoTo)
296                                                || (action instanceof PDActionImportData)
297                                        ) {
298                                            keep = true;
299                                        }
300                                    }
301                                    return keep;
302                                }
303                            };
304                            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
305                                try {
306                                    notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.add(page.getAnnotations(notAllowedAnnotationFilter).size());
307                                } catch (IOException e) {
308                                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
309                                }
310                            });
311                            if (notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.stream().reduce(0, Integer::sum) == 0) {
312                                isSafe = true;
313                            }
314                        }
315                    }
316                }
317            }
318        } catch (Exception e) {
319            isSafe = false;
320        }
321        return isSafe;
322    }
323
324    /**
325     * Remove as much as possible metadata from the provided PDF document object.
326     *
327     * @param document PDFBox PDF document object on which metadata must be removed.
328     * @see "https://gist.github.com/righettod/d7e07443c43d393a39de741a0d920069"
329     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
330     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
331     */
332    public static void clearPDFMetadata(PDDocument document) {
333        if (document != null) {
334            PDDocumentInformation infoEmpty = new PDDocumentInformation();
335            document.setDocumentInformation(infoEmpty);
336            PDMetadata newMetadataEmpty = new PDMetadata(document);
337            document.getDocumentCatalog().setMetadata(newMetadataEmpty);
338        }
339    }
340
341
342    /**
343     * Validate that the URL provided is really a relative URL.
344     *
345     * @param targetUrl URL to validate.
346     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
347     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
348     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/q/6785442"
349     */
350    public static boolean isRelativeURL(String targetUrl) {
351        boolean isValid = false;
352        //Reject any URL encoded content and URL starting with a double slash
353        //Reject any URL contains credentials or fragment to prevent potential bypasses
354        String work = targetUrl;
355        if (!work.contains("%") && !work.contains("@") && !work.contains("#") && !work.startsWith("//")) {
356            //Creation of a URL object must fail
357            try {
358                new URL(work);
359                isValid = false;
360            } catch (MalformedURLException mf) {
361                //Last check to be sure (for prod usage compile the pattern one time)
362                isValid = Pattern.compile("^/[a-z0-9]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(work).find();
363            }
364        }
365        return isValid;
366    }
367
368    /**
369     * Apply a collection of validations on a ZIP file provided:<br>
370     * - Real ZIP file<br>
371     * - Contain less than a specified level of deepness.<br>
372     * - Do not contain Zip-Slip entry path.<br>
373     *
374     * @param zipFilePath       Filename of the ZIP file to check.
375     * @param maxLevelDeepness  Threshold of deepness above which a ZIP archive will be rejected.
376     * @param rejectArchiveFile Flag to specify if presence of any archive entry will cause the rejection of the ZIP file.
377     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
378     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Security%20Hotspot/RSPEC-5042"
379     * @see "https://security.snyk.io/research/zip-slip-vulnerability"
380     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb"
381     * @see "https://github.com/ptoomey3/evilarc"
382     * @see "https://github.com/abdulfatir/ZipBomb"
383     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/cs/zip-bomb"
384     * @see "https://thesecurityvault.com/attacks-with-zip-files-and-mitigations/"
385     * @see "https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream"
386     */
387    public static boolean isZIPSafe(String zipFilePath, int maxLevelDeepness, boolean rejectArchiveFile) {
388        List<String> archiveExtensions = Arrays.asList("zip", "tar", "7z", "gz", "jar", "phar", "bz2", "tgz");
389        boolean isSafe = false;
390        try {
391            File zipFile = new File(zipFilePath);
392            if (zipFile.exists() && zipFile.canRead() && zipFile.isFile() && maxLevelDeepness > 0) {
393                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid ZIP file
394                try (ZipFile zipArch = new ZipFile(zipFile)) {
395                    //Step 2: Parse entries
396                    long deepness = 0;
397                    ZipEntry zipEntry;
398                    String entryExtension;
399                    String zipEntryName;
400                    boolean validationsFailed = false;
401                    Enumeration<? extends ZipEntry> entries = zipArch.entries();
402                    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
403                        zipEntry = entries.nextElement();
404                        zipEntryName = zipEntry.getName();
405                        entryExtension = zipEntryName.substring(zipEntryName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).trim();
406                        //Step 2a: Check if the current entry is an archive file
407                        if (rejectArchiveFile && archiveExtensions.contains(entryExtension)) {
408                            validationsFailed = true;
409                            break;
410                        }
411                        //Step 2b: Check that level of deepness is inferior to the threshold specified
412                        if (zipEntryName.contains("/")) {
413                            //Determine deepness by inspecting the entry name.
414                            //Indeed, folder will be represented like this: folder/folder/folder/
415                            //So we can count the number of "/" to identify the deepness of the entry
416                            deepness = zipEntryName.chars().filter(ch -> ch == '/').count();
417                            if (deepness > maxLevelDeepness) {
418                                validationsFailed = true;
419                                break;
420                            }
421                        }
422                        //Step 2c: Check if any entries match pattern of zip slip payload
423                        if (zipEntryName.contains("..\\") || zipEntryName.contains("../")) {
424                            validationsFailed = true;
425                            break;
426                        }
427                    }
428                    if (!validationsFailed) {
429                        isSafe = true;
430                    }
431                }
432            }
433        } catch (Exception e) {
434            isSafe = false;
435        }
436        return isSafe;
437    }
438
439    /**
440     * Identify the mime type of the content specified (array of bytes).<br>
441     * Note that it cannot be fully trusted (see the tweet '1595824709186519041' referenced), so, additional validations are required.
442     *
443     * @param content The content as an array of bytes.
444     * @return The mime type in lower case or null if it cannot be identified.
445     * @see "https://twitter.com/righettod/status/1595824709186519041"
446     * @see "https://tika.apache.org/"
447     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.tika/tika-core"
448     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types"
449     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml"
450     */
451    public static String identifyMimeType(byte[] content) {
452        String mimeType = null;
453        if (content != null && content.length > 0) {
454            Detector detector = new DefaultDetector(MimeTypes.getDefaultMimeTypes());
455            Metadata metadata = new Metadata();
456            try {
457                try (TemporaryResources temporaryResources = new TemporaryResources(); TikaInputStream tikaInputStream = TikaInputStream.get(new ByteArrayInputStream(content), temporaryResources, metadata)) {
458                    MediaType mt = detector.detect(tikaInputStream, metadata);
459                    if (mt != null) {
460                        mimeType = mt.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
461                    }
462                }
463            } catch (IOException ioe) {
464                mimeType = null;
465            }
466        }
467        return mimeType;
468    }
469
470    /**
471     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an public IP address:<br>
472     * - Is a valid IP v4 or v6 address.<br>
473     * - Is public from an Internet perspective.<br><br>
474     * <b>Note:</b> I often see missing such validation in the value read from HTTP request headers like "X-Forwarded-For" or "Forwarded".
475     * <br>
476     * <b>Note for IPv6:</b> I used documentation found so it is really experimental!
477     *
478     * @param ip String expected to be a valid IP address.
479     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
480     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
481     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/InetAddressValidator.html"
482     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html"
483     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_Orange_Tsai_Talk.pdf"
484     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_SSRF_Bible.pdf"
485     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For"
486     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Forwarded"
487     * @see "https://ipcisco.com/lesson/ipv6-address/"
488     * @see "https://www.juniper.net/documentation/us/en/software/junos/interfaces-security-devices/topics/topic-map/security-interface-ipv4-ipv6-protocol.html"
489     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.base/java/net/InetAddress.html#getByName(java.lang.String)"
490     * @see "https://www.arin.net/reference/research/statistics/address_filters/"
491     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicast_address"
492     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/5619409"
493     * @see "https://www.ripe.net/media/documents/ipv6-address-types.pdf"
494     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments.xhtml"
495     * @see "https://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/Inet6Address"
496     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address"
497     */
498    public static boolean isPublicIPAddress(String ip) {
499        boolean isValid = false;
500        try {
501            //Quick validation on the string itself based on characters used to compose an IP v4/v6 address
502            if (Pattern.matches("[0-9a-fA-F:.]+", ip)) {
503                //If OK then use the dedicated InetAddressValidator from Apache Commons Validator
504                if (InetAddressValidator.getInstance().isValid(ip)) {
505                    //If OK then validate that is an public IP address
506                    //From Javadoc for "InetAddress.getByName": If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
507                    InetAddress addr = InetAddress.getByName(ip);
508                    isValid = (!addr.isAnyLocalAddress() && !addr.isLinkLocalAddress()
509                            && !addr.isLoopbackAddress() && !addr.isMulticastAddress()
510                            && !addr.isSiteLocalAddress());
511                    //If OK and the IP is an V6 one then make additional validation because the built-in Java API will let pass some V6 IP
512                    //For the prefix map, the start of the key indicates if the value is a regex or a string
513                    if (isValid && (addr instanceof Inet6Address)) {
514                        Map<String, String> prefixes = new HashMap<>();
515                        prefixes.put("REGEX_LOOPBACK", "^(0|:)+1$");
516                        prefixes.put("REGEX_UNIQUE-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "^f(c|d)[a-f0-9]{2}:.*$");
517                        prefixes.put("STRING_LINK-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "fe80:");
518                        prefixes.put("REGEX_TEREDO", "^2001:[0]*:.*$");
519                        prefixes.put("REGEX_BENCHMARKING", "^2001:[0]*2:.*$");
520                        prefixes.put("REGEX_ORCHID", "^2001:[0]*10:.*$");
521                        prefixes.put("STRING_DOCUMENTATION", "2001:db8:");
522                        prefixes.put("STRING_GLOBAL-UNICAST", "2000:");
523                        prefixes.put("REGEX_MULTICAST", "^ff[0-9]{2}:.*$");
524                        final List<Boolean> results = new ArrayList<>();
525                        final String ipLower = ip.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
526                        prefixes.forEach((addressType, expr) -> {
527                            String exprLower = expr.trim().toLowerCase();
528                            if (addressType.startsWith("STRING_")) {
529                                results.add(ipLower.startsWith(exprLower));
530                            } else {
531                                results.add(Pattern.matches(exprLower, ipLower));
532                            }
533                        });
534                        isValid = ((results.size() == prefixes.size()) && !results.contains(Boolean.TRUE));
535                    }
536                }
537            }
538        } catch (Exception e) {
539            isValid = false;
540        }
541        return isValid;
542    }
543
544    /**
545     * Compute a SHA256 hash from an input composed of a collection of strings.<br>
546     * This method take care to build the source string in a way to prevent this source string to be prone to abuse targeting the different parts composing it.<br>
547     * Example of possible abuse without precautions applied during the hash calculation logic:<br>
548     * Hash of <code>SHA256("Hello", "My", "World!!!")</code> will be equals to the hash of <code>SHA256("Hell", "oMyW", "orld!!!")</code>.<br>
549     * This method ensure that both hash above will be different.
550     *
551     * @param parts Ordered list of strings to use to build the input string for which the hash must be computed on. No null value is accepted on object composing the collection.
552     * @return The hash, as an array of bytes, to allow caller to convert it to the final representation wanted (HEX, Base64, etc.). If the collection passed is null or empty then the method return null.
553     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs
554     * @see "https://pentesterlab.com/badges/codereview"
555     */
556    public static byte[] computeHashNoProneToAbuseOnParts(List<String> parts) throws Exception {
557        byte[] hash = null;
558        if (parts != null && !parts.isEmpty()) {
559            //Ensure that not part is null
560            if (parts.stream().anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
561                throw new IllegalArgumentException("No part must be null!");
562            }
563            String separator = "|";
564            MessageDigest digest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-256");
565            final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(separator);
566            parts.forEach(p -> {
567                buffer.append(p).append(separator);
568            });
569            hash = digest.digest(buffer.toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
570        }
571        return hash;
572    }
573
574    /**
575     * Ensure that an XML file only uses DTD/XSD references (called System Identifier) present in the allowed list provided.<br>
576     * The code is based on the validation implemented into the OpenJDK 21, by the class <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java">java.util.prefs.XmlSupport</a></b>, in the method <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L240">loadPrefsDoc()</a></b>.<br>
577     * The method also ensure that no Public Identifier is used to prevent potential bypasses of the validations.
578     *
579     * @param xmlFilePath              Filename of the XML file to check.
580     * @param allowedSystemIdentifiers List of URL allowed for System Identifier specified for any XSD/DTD references.
581     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
582     * @see "https://www.w3schools.com/xml/prop_documenttype_systemid.asp"
583     * @see "https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/integration-bus/9.0.0?topic=doctypedecl-xml-systemid"
584     * @see "https://www.liquid-technologies.com/Reference/Glossary/XML_DocType.html"
585     * @see "https://www.xml.com/pub/98/08/xmlqna0.html"
586     * @see "https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L397"
587     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formal_Public_Identifier"
588     */
589    public static boolean isXMLOnlyUseAllowedXSDorDTD(String xmlFilePath, final List<String> allowedSystemIdentifiers) {
590        boolean isSafe = false;
591        final String errorTemplate = "Non allowed %s ID detected!";
592        final String emptyFakeDTD = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?><!ELEMENT dummy EMPTY>";
593        final String emptyFakeXSD = "<xs:schema xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\"> <xs:element name=\"dummy\"/></xs:schema>";
594
595        if (allowedSystemIdentifiers == null || allowedSystemIdentifiers.isEmpty()) {
596            throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least one SID must be specified!");
597        }
598        File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
599        if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
600            try {
601                EntityResolver resolverValidator = (publicId, systemId) -> {
602                    if (publicId != null) {
603                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "PUBLIC"));
604                    }
605                    if (!allowedSystemIdentifiers.contains(systemId)) {
606                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "SYSTEM"));
607                    }
608                    //If it is OK then return a empty DTD/XSD
609                    return new InputSource(new StringReader(systemId.toLowerCase().endsWith(".dtd") ? emptyFakeDTD : emptyFakeXSD));
610                };
611                DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
612                dbfInstance.setIgnoringElementContentWhitespace(true);
613                dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
614                dbfInstance.setValidating(false);
615                dbfInstance.setCoalescing(true);
616                dbfInstance.setIgnoringComments(false);
617                DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
618                builder.setEntityResolver(resolverValidator);
619                Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
620                isSafe = (doc != null);
621            } catch (SAXException | IOException | ParserConfigurationException e) {
622                isSafe = false;
623            }
624        }
625
626        return isSafe;
627    }
628
629    /**
630     * Apply a collection of validations on a EXCEL CSV file provided (file was expected to be opened in Microsoft EXCEL):<br>
631     * - Real CSV file.<br>
632     * - Do not contains any payload related to a CSV injections.<br><br>
633     * Ensure that, if Apache Commons CSV does not find any record then, the file will be considered as NOT safe (prevent potential bypasses).<br><br>
634     * <b>Note:</b> Record delimiter used is the <code>,</code> (comma) character. See the Apache Commons CSV reference provided for EXCEL.<br>
635     *
636     * @param csvFilePath Filename of the CSV file to check.
637     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
638     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/"
639     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/apidocs/org/apache/commons/csv/CSVFormat.html#EXCEL"
640     * @see "https://www.we45.com/post/your-excel-sheets-are-not-safe-heres-how-to-beat-csv-injection"
641     * @see "https://www.whiteoaksecurity.com/blog/2020-4-23-csv-injection-whats-the-risk/"
642     * @see "https://book.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting-web/formula-csv-doc-latex-ghostscript-injection"
643     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/CSV_Injection"
644     * @see "https://payatu.com/blog/csv-injection-basic-to-exploit/"
645     * @see "https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1236.html"
646     */
647    public static boolean isExcelCSVSafe(String csvFilePath) {
648        boolean isSafe;
649        final AtomicInteger recordCount = new AtomicInteger();
650        final List<Character> payloadDetectionCharacters = List.of('=', '+', '@', '-', '\r', '\t');
651
652        try {
653            final List<String> payloadsIdentified = new ArrayList<>();
654            try (Reader in = new FileReader(csvFilePath)) {
655                Iterable<CSVRecord> records = CSVFormat.EXCEL.parse(in);
656                records.forEach(record -> {
657                    record.forEach(recordValue -> {
658                        if (recordValue != null && !recordValue.trim().isEmpty() && payloadDetectionCharacters.contains(recordValue.trim().charAt(0))) {
659                            payloadsIdentified.add(recordValue);
660                        }
661                        recordCount.getAndIncrement();
662                    });
663                });
664            }
665            isSafe = (payloadsIdentified.isEmpty() && recordCount.get() > 0);
666        } catch (Exception e) {
667            isSafe = false;
668        }
669
670        return isSafe;
671    }
672}
